Latin-1 (ISO-8859-1) Character Encoding Test

This page contains Western European characters encoded in Latin-1.

German Characters (ISO-8859-1)

Umlauts: ä ö ü Ä Ö Ü

Eszett (sharp s): ß

Example words: Grüße, Größe, Straße, Müller,öffnen

Sentence: Die Größe beträgt 15°C. Grüße aus München!

French Characters (ISO-8859-1)

Accents: à â ç é è ê ë î ï ô ù û ü

Cedilla: ç

Example words: garçon, café, naïve, façade, Noël, forêt

Sentence: Le garçon boit un café. Noël arrive bientôt!

Spanish Characters (ISO-8859-1)

Accents: á é í ó ú ñ Ñ ¿ ¡

Tilde: ñ Ñ

Inverted punctuation: ¿ ¡

Example words: niño, jalapeño, teléfono, canción, corazón

Sentence: ¡Hola! ¿Cómo estás? El niño está en el jardín.

Italian Characters (ISO-8859-1)

Accents: à è é ì ò ù

Example words: perché, città, più, così, libreria

Sentence: Perché non viene? La città è bella!

Portuguese Characters (ISO-8859-1)

Accents: à á â ã ç é ê í ó ô õ ú

Tilde: ã õ

Cedilla: ç

Example words: coração, amanhã, avô, nação, São Paulo

Sentence: O coração do avô. Amanhã é um novo dia!

Scandinavian Characters (ISO-8859-1)

Danish/Norwegian: æ ø å Æ Ø Å

Swedish/Finnish: å ä ö Å Ä Ö

Icelandic: ð þ Ð Þ

Danish words: rødgrød, fløde, København

Norwegian words: får, gjøre, hånd

Swedish words: skål, göra, hand

Icelandic words: þing, saga, ég

Dutch Characters (ISO-8859-1)

Accents: á é ï ñ ó ö ú ü

Example words: coöperatie, naïef, résumé, café

Sentence: Hij werkt in een coöperatie in het café.

Punctuation and Symbols

Quotes: « » (French guillemets)

Currency: £ ¥

Dashes: — –

Bullets: • † ‡ ‰

Special Characters

Copyright: ©

Registered: ®

Trademark: ™

Degree: °

Plus-minus: ±

Multiplication: ×

Division: ÷

Micro: µ

Paragraph: ¶

Section: §

Code Examples

// German comments
// Größe und Anzahl berechnen
int größe = 10;
int anzahl = 5;

// French comments
// Calculer la somme
int somme = a + b;
# Spanish comments
# Calcular el área
def calcular_area(ancho, alto):
    return ancho * alto

# Portuguese comments
# Área do círculo
area = 3.14 * raio ** 2

Table with Latin-1 Content

Language Example Meaning
German Guten Tag Good day
French Bonjour Hello
Spanish Buenos días Good morning
Italian Buongiorno Good morning
Portuguese Bom dia Good morning
Dutch Goedendag Good day
Swedish God dag Good day
Norwegian God dag Good day
Danish Goddag Good day

Mixed Language Paragraph

This paragraph contains multiple Western European languages. Here's some German: Grüße aus Deutschland! Some French: Bien sûr, mon ami! A bit of Spanish: ¡Hola! ¿Qué tal? And Italian: Perché no? Finally, Portuguese: Obrigado!

Temperature and Measurements

Temperature: 25°C

Size: 15cm × 20cm

Weight: 75kg

Angle: 90°

Common Words

  • German: Französisch, Straße, Schüler
  • French: français, Noël, élève
  • Spanish: español, niño, corazón
  • Italian: italiano, perché, città
  • Portuguese: português, coração, nação
  • Danish: dansk, København, rødgrød
  • Norwegian: norsk, København, rødgrøt
  • Swedish: svenska, Göteborg, köttbullar

Names with Latin-1 Characters

  • Hans Müller
  • François LeBlanc
  • José García
  • Giovanni Rossi
  • João Silva
  • Kåre Johansen
  • Jørgen Nielsen
  • Søren Kierkegaard
  • Björn Andersson
  • Øystein

Place Names

  • München, Germany (Munich)
  • Zürich, Switzerland (Zurich)
  • København, Denmark (Copenhagen)
  • Göteborg, Sweden (Gothenburg)
  • Málaga, Spain (Malaga)
  • São Paulo, Brazil (Sao Paulo)
  • A Coruña, Spain (La Coruña)

Book Titles

  • Das Boot (German)
  • Les Misérables (French)
  • Don Quijote de la Mancha (Spanish)
  • Il Nome della Rosa (Italian)
  • O Príncipe (Portuguese)

Special Punctuation

French guillemets: « citation »

Inverted Spanish punctuation: ¡Hola! ¿Qué tal?

Dashes: word—em dash—word

Mathematical Symbols

Plus-minus: ±

Multiplication: ×

Division: ÷

Not equal: ≠

Less than or equal: ≤

Greater than or equal: ≥

Fraction one quarter: ¼

Fraction one half: ½

Fraction three quarters: ¾

Currency Symbols

Pound sterling: £

Yen/Yuan: ¥

General currency: ¤

Accented Letters Complete Set

Capital A: À Á Â Ã Ä Å Æ

Capital C: Ç

Capital E: È É Ê Ë

Capital I: Ì Í Î Ï

Capital N: Ñ

Capital O: Ò Ó Ô Õ Ö Ø

Capital U: Ù Ú Û Ü

Small a: à á â ã ä å æ

Small c: ç

Small e: è é ê ë

Small i: ì í î ï

Small n: ñ

Small o: ò ó ô õ ö ø

Small u: ù ú û ü

Quotation Marks

Left single quotes: ‹ ›

Left double quotes: « »

File Paths with Latin-1

/home/user/dokument/cafe.txt
C:\Users\Müller\Dokumente\Größe.txt
~/usr/local/café/document.pdf

URLs with Latin-1 Characters

URL with umlaut
URL with special char
URL without accents (encoded)

Code with Latin-1 Comments

/**
 * Klasse für Benutzerdaten
 * Autor: Müller
 */
public class Benutzer {
    private String name;

    // Größe in Zentimetern
    private int größe;

    public void setName(String name) {
        this.name = name;
    }
}

Scientific Units

Micro: µm (micrometer), µg (microgram)

Ohm: Ω (omega symbol)

Degree: 90° (degrees)

Conclusion

This page demonstrates Latin-1 (ISO-8859-1) encoding which supports Western European languages. The encoding includes characters for German, French, Spanish, Italian, Portuguese, Dutch, and Scandinavian languages.
